verses.kjv: Now it came to pass upon a day, that Jonathan the son of Saul said unto the young man that bare his armour, Come, and let us go over to the Philistines’ garrison, that is on the other side. But he told not his father.
verses.ct: One day Jonathan, Saul's son, said to the young man who carried his weapons, "Let's cross over to the Philistine outpost on the other side." But he didn't tell his father about it.

verses.kjv: And Saul tarried in the uttermost part of Gibeah under a pomegranate tree which is in Migron: and the people that were with him were about six hundred men;
verses.ct: Saul was staying on the outskirts of Gibeah, under a pomegranate tree in Migron. The troops with him numbered about 600 men.

verses.kjv: And Ahiah, the son of Ahitub, Ichabod’s brother, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eli, the LORD’s priest in Shiloh, wearing an ephod. And the people knew not that Jonathan was gone.
verses.ct: Ahiah was there — the son of Ahitub, who was the brother of Ichabod, son of Phinehas, son of Eli, the LORD's priest at Shiloh — and he was wearing an ephod. The people had no idea that Jonathan had left.

verses.kjv: And between the passages, by which Jonathan sought to go over unto the Philistines’ garrison, there was a sharp rock on the one side, and a sharp rock on the other side: and the name of the one was Bozez, and the name of the other Seneh.
verses.ct: On either side of the pass that Jonathan planned to use to reach the Philistine outpost, there was a steep rocky cliff. One was called Bozez and the other Seneh.

verses.kjv: The forefront of the one was situate northward over against Michmash, and the other southward over against Gibeah.
verses.ct: One cliff faced north toward Michmash, and the other faced south toward Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And Jonathan said to the young man that bare his armour, Come, and let us go over unto the garrison of these uncircumcised: it may be that the LORD will work for us: for there is no restraint to the LORD to save by many or by few.
verses.ct: Jonathan said to his armor-bearer, "Let's cross over to the outpost of these uncircumcised men. Maybe the LORD will act on our behalf — nothing stops the LORD from winning a victory, whether through many soldiers or just a few."

verses.kjv: And his armourbearer said unto him, Do all that is in thine heart: turn thee; behold, I am with thee according to thy heart.
verses.ct: His armor-bearer replied, "Go ahead and do whatever you have in mind. I'm right behind you, whatever you decide."

verses.kjv: Then said Jonathan, Behold, we will pass over unto these men, and we will discover ourselves unto them.
verses.ct: Then Jonathan said, "Here's the plan: we'll cross over toward those men and let them see us.

verses.kjv: If they say thus unto us, Tarry until we come to you; then we will stand still in our place, and will not go up unto them.
verses.ct: If they tell us, 'Stay there until we come down to you,' then we'll hold our position and won't go up to them.

verses.kjv: But if they say thus, Come up unto us; then we will go up: for the LORD hath delivered them into our hand: and this shall be a sign unto us.
verses.ct: But if they say, 'Come up here to us,' then we'll climb up, because that will be the LORD's signal that he has given us victory over them."

verses.kjv: And both of them discovered themselves unto the garrison of the Philistines: and the Philistines said, Behold, the Hebrews come forth out of the holes where they had hid themselves.
verses.ct: So the two of them showed themselves to the Philistine outpost. The Philistines said, "Look — the Hebrews are crawling out of the holes they've been hiding in!"

verses.kjv: And the men of the garrison answered Jonathan and his armourbearer, and said, Come up to us, and we will shew you a thing. And Jonathan said unto his armourbearer, Come up after me: for the LORD hath delivered them into the hand of Israel.
verses.ct: The soldiers at the outpost called down to Jonathan and his armor-bearer, "Come on up here, and we'll teach you a lesson!" Jonathan said to his armor-bearer, "Follow me up, because the LORD has given Israel victory over them!"

verses.kjv: And Jonathan climbed up upon his hands and upon his feet, and his armourbearer after him: and they fell before Jonathan; and his armourbearer slew after him.
verses.ct: Jonathan scrambled up on his hands and feet, with his armor-bearer right behind him. The enemy fell before Jonathan, and his armor-bearer finished them off behind him.

verses.kjv: And that first slaughter, which Jonathan and his armourbearer made, was about twenty men, within as it were an half acre of land, which a yoke of oxen might plow.
verses.ct: In that first attack, Jonathan and his armor-bearer killed about 20 men within an area of about half an acre of land.

verses.kjv: And there was trembling in the host, in the field, and among all the people: the garrison, and the spoilers, they also trembled, and the earth quaked: so it was a very great trembling.
verses.ct: Panic spread through the entire Philistine camp — among the troops in the field, at the outpost, and among the raiding parties. The ground itself shook, and it became an overwhelming terror from God.

verses.kjv: And the watchmen of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked; and, behold, the multitude melted away, and they went on beating down one another.
verses.ct: Saul's lookouts in Gibeah of Benjamin watched as the Philistine forces scattered in every direction, turning on each other in confusion.

verses.kjv: Then said Saul unto the people that were with him, Number now, and see who is gone from us. And when they had numbered, behold, Jonathan and his armourbearer were not there.
verses.ct: Saul told the troops with him, "Do a head count and find out who's missing from our ranks." When they checked, Jonathan and his armor-bearer were gone.

verses.kjv: And Saul said unto Ahiah, Bring hither the ark of God. For the ark of God was at that time with the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Saul said to Ahiah, "Bring the ark of God here." The ark of God was with the Israelites at that time.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, while Saul talked unto the priest, that the noise that was in the host of the Philistines went on and increased: and Saul said unto the priest, Withdraw thine hand.
verses.ct: While Saul was still speaking to the priest, the commotion in the Philistine camp kept growing louder and louder. So Saul told the priest, "Never mind — pull your hand back."

verses.kjv: And Saul and all the people that were with him assembled themselves, and they came to the battle: and, behold, every man’s sword was against his fellow, and there was a very great discomfiture.
verses.ct: Saul and all his troops rallied together and rushed into battle. They found the Philistines in total chaos, attacking each other with their own swords in massive confusion.

verses.kjv: Moreover the Hebrews that were with the Philistines before that time, which went up with them into the camp from the country round about, even they also turned to be with the Israelites that were with Saul and Jonathan.
verses.ct: Even the Hebrews who had previously sided with the Philistines and gone up with them into their camp switched sides and joined the Israelites under Saul and Jonathan.

verses.kjv: Likewise all the men of Israel which had hid themselves in mount Ephraim, when they heard that the Philistines fled, even they also followed hard after them in the battle.
verses.ct: Also, all the Israelite men who had been hiding in the hill country of Ephraim heard that the Philistines were running, so they joined the chase and pressed hard after them in battle.

verses.kjv: So the LORD saved Israel that day: and the battle passed over unto Bethaven.
verses.ct: The LORD rescued Israel that day, and the fighting moved on past Beth-aven.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel were distressed that day: for Saul had adjured the people, saying, Cursed be the man that eateth any food until evening, that I may be avenged on mine enemies. So none of the people tasted any food.
verses.ct: The Israelite soldiers were exhausted that day because Saul had bound the troops with an oath, saying, "Cursed is anyone who eats any food before evening, until I've taken full revenge on my enemies." So no one ate anything.

verses.kjv: And all they of the land came to a wood; and there was honey upon the ground.
verses.ct: The whole army entered a wooded area, and there was honey on the ground.

verses.kjv: And when the people were come into the wood, behold, the honey dropped; but no man put his hand to his mouth: for the people feared the oath.
verses.ct: When the troops went into the woods, they could see honey dripping everywhere, but no one touched it or raised a hand to his mouth, because they were afraid of the oath.

verses.kjv: But Jonathan heard not when his father charged the people with the oath: wherefore he put forth the end of the rod that was in his hand, and dipped it in an honeycomb, and put his hand to his mouth; and his eyes were enlightened.
verses.ct: But Jonathan hadn't heard when his father made the troops swear the oath. So he reached out with the tip of the staff he was carrying, dipped it into a honeycomb, and ate some. Immediately his energy was restored.

verses.kjv: Then answered one of the people, and said, Thy father straitly charged the people with an oath, saying, Cursed be the man that eateth any food this day. And the people were faint.
verses.ct: One of the soldiers spoke up and said, "Your father strictly bound the troops with an oath, saying, 'Cursed is anyone who eats food today.'" The troops were weak with hunger.

verses.kjv: Then said Jonathan, My father hath troubled the land: see, I pray you, how mine eyes have been enlightened, because I tasted a little of this honey.
verses.ct: Jonathan replied, "My father has caused trouble for the whole country. Just look at how my energy came back from tasting this little bit of honey.

verses.kjv: How much more, if haply the people had eaten freely to day of the spoil of their enemies which they found? for had there not been now a much greater slaughter among the Philistines?
verses.ct: Think how much better it would have been if the troops had eaten freely today from the plunder they took from their enemies! The defeat of the Philistines would have been far greater."

verses.kjv: And they smote the Philistines that day from Michmash to Aijalon: and the people were very faint.
verses.ct: That day they struck down the Philistines from Michmash all the way to Aijalon, and the troops were completely drained.

verses.kjv: And the people flew upon the spoil, and took sheep, and oxen, and calves, and slew them on the ground: and the people did eat them with the blood.
verses.ct: The troops threw themselves on the plunder and grabbed sheep, cattle, and calves, slaughtering them right there on the ground and eating the meat with the blood still in it.

verses.kjv: Then they told Saul, saying, Behold, the people sin against the LORD, in that they eat with the blood. And he said, Ye have transgressed: roll a great stone unto me this day.
verses.ct: Someone reported to Saul, "Look, the troops are sinning against the LORD by eating meat with the blood still in it!" Saul said, "You have all broken God's law! Roll a large stone over here to me right now."

verses.kjv: And Saul said, Disperse yourselves among the people, and say unto them, Bring me hither every man his ox, and every man his sheep, and slay them here, and eat; and sin not against the LORD in eating with the blood. And all the people brought every man his ox with him that night, and slew them there.
verses.ct: Then Saul ordered, "Spread out among the troops and tell them, 'Each of you bring your ox or your sheep here, slaughter them on this stone, and then eat. Don't sin against the LORD by eating meat with the blood in it.'" So that night every person brought their animal and slaughtered it there.

verses.kjv: And Saul built an altar unto the LORD: the same was the first altar that he built unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Saul built an altar to the LORD. This was the first altar he ever built to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Saul said, Let us go down after the Philistines by night, and spoil them until the morning light, and let us not leave a man of them. And they said, Do whatsoever seemeth good unto thee. Then said the priest, Let us draw near hither unto God.
verses.ct: Saul said, "Let's go after the Philistines tonight and plunder them until dawn. Let's not leave a single one of them alive." The troops replied, "Do whatever you think is best." But the priest said, "Let's consult God first."

verses.kjv: And Saul asked counsel of God, Shall I go down after the Philistines? wilt thou deliver them into the hand of Israel? But he answered him not that day.
verses.ct: So Saul asked God, "Should I pursue the Philistines? Will you give Israel victory over them?" But God gave him no answer that day.

verses.kjv: And Saul said, Draw ye near hither, all the chief of the people: and know and see wherein this sin hath been this day.
verses.ct: Saul said, "All you leaders of the army, come here. We need to find out what sin was committed today.

verses.kjv: For, as the LORD liveth, which saveth Israel, though it be in Jonathan my son, he shall surely die. But there was not a man among all the people that answered him.
verses.ct: As surely as the LORD who rescues Israel lives, even if the guilt falls on my son Jonathan, he will certainly die." But not one person among all the troops said a word.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto all Israel, Be ye on one side, and I and Jonathan my son will be on the other side. And the people said unto Saul, Do what seemeth good unto thee.
verses.ct: Then he told all Israel, "You stand on one side, and Jonathan and I will stand on the other side." The troops said to Saul, "Do whatever you think is right."

verses.kjv: Therefore Saul said unto the LORD God of Israel, Give a perfect lot. And Saul and Jonathan were taken: but the people escaped.
verses.ct: So Saul prayed to the LORD, the God of Israel, "Reveal the truth." The lot fell on Saul and Jonathan, and the rest of the troops were cleared.

verses.kjv: And Saul said, Cast lots between me and Jonathan my son. And Jonathan was taken.
verses.ct: Saul said, "Now cast the lot between me and my son Jonathan." The lot fell on Jonathan.

verses.kjv: Then Saul said to Jonathan, Tell me what thou hast done. And Jonathan told him, and said, I did but taste a little honey with the end of the rod that was in mine hand, and, lo, I must die.
verses.ct: Saul said to Jonathan, "Tell me what you did." Jonathan answered, "All I did was taste a little honey on the tip of the staff I was holding. And now I must die for it?"

verses.kjv: And Saul answered, God do so and more also: for thou shalt surely die, Jonathan.
verses.ct: Saul declared, "May God punish me severely if you don't die for this, Jonathan."

verses.kjv: And the people said unto Saul, Shall Jonathan die, who hath wrought this great salvation in Israel? God forbid: as the LORD liveth, there shall not one hair of his head fall to the ground; for he hath wrought with God this day. So the people rescued Jonathan, that he died not.
verses.ct: But the troops said to Saul, "Should Jonathan die — the one who brought about this incredible victory for Israel? Absolutely not! As surely as the LORD lives, not a single hair on his head will be harmed, because God was working through him today." So the troops rescued Jonathan, and he was not put to death.

verses.kjv: Then Saul went up from following the Philistines: and the Philistines went to their own place.
verses.ct: Then Saul stopped pursuing the Philistines, and the Philistines returned to their own territory.

verses.kjv: So Saul took the kingdom over Israel, and fought against all his enemies on every side, against Moab, and against the children of Ammon, and against Edom, and against the kings of Zobah, and against the Philistines: and whithersoever he turned himself, he vexed them.
verses.ct: After Saul secured his rule over Israel, he fought against enemies on every side — against Moab, the Ammonites, Edom, the kings of Zobah, and the Philistines. Wherever he turned, he defeated them.

verses.kjv: And he gathered an host, and smote the Amalekites, and delivered Israel out of the hands of them that spoiled them.
verses.ct: He assembled an army and attacked the Amalekites, rescuing Israel from those who had been raiding them.

verses.kjv: Now the sons of Saul were Jonathan, and Ishui, and Melchishua: and the names of his two daughters were these; the name of the firstborn Merab, and the name of the younger Michal:
verses.ct: Saul's sons were Jonathan, Ishui, and Melchishua. His 2 daughters were Merab, the firstborn, and Michal, the younger.

verses.kjv: And the name of Saul’s wife was Ahinoam, the daughter of Ahimaaz: and the name of the captain of his host was Abner, the son of Ner, Saul’s uncle.
verses.ct: Saul's wife was Ahinoam, the daughter of Ahimaaz. The commander of his army was Abner, son of Ner, who was Saul's uncle.

verses.kjv: And Kish was the father of Saul; and Ner the father of Abner was the son of Abiel.
verses.ct: Kish was Saul's father, and Ner, Abner's father, was the son of Abiel.

verses.kjv: And there was sore war against the Philistines all the days of Saul: and when Saul saw any strong man, or any valiant man, he took him unto him.
verses.ct: The war against the Philistines was fierce throughout Saul's entire reign. Whenever Saul spotted a strong or brave warrior, he recruited him into his forces.
